answers.answer: http://www.medhelp.org/posts/show/578275Hi,Do you also feel any weakness of the muscles of the legs or feet? Could be a Neurological illness like entrapment of the nerve of the leg.Do you have excessive thirst/frequent urination/increased hunger? Possibility of Diabetes.Please let me know.Firstly, I’ll request you to get your blood sugar/HbA1c (glycated hemoglobin) tested to rule out Diabetes mellitus.You also need a neurological examination by a neurologist.You may need tests like Nerve Conduction Velocity etc.Pl don’t delay and request you to get yourself examined at the earliest.Please do keep me posted.Kind Rgds.

question: I have tingling below my knees and numbness on my left big toe.
title: tingling
